The user has approved the restart. According to the predefined directives, I need to execute the restart using the EC2 Remediation Assistant tool.\",\"Action\":{\"Action Reason\":\"The user has approved the restart of the EC2 instance. I will use the EC2 Remediation Assistant tool to perform the restart as per the predefined directives.\",\"Name\":\"EC2 Remediation Assistant\"},\"Action Inputs\":{\"instance_id\":{\"Action Input Reason\":\"The instance ID i-02e539d855ab0f256 was provided by the user and confirmed for restart. It is mandatory for the EC2 Remediation Assistant tool.\",\"Value\":\"i-02e539d855ab0f256\"}},\"URL\":\"/sys_gen_ai_log_metadata.do?sys_id=bd51a2de834072107f44e024ccda1ee9\",\"Time\":\"3511\"}"}</output><parent display_value="Created 2025-09-20 04:32:02">704162de834072107f44e024ccda1e64</parent><status>success</status><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-20 04:32:18</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>f451a2de834072107f44e024ccda1e7d</sys_id><sys_mod_count>1</sys_mod_count><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-20 04:32:22</sys_updated_on><target_document_id>undefined</target_document_id><target_document_table>undefined</target_document_table><task_dependencies/><type>gen_ai</type></sn_aia_execution_task></record_update>

sys_update_xml.name: sn_aia_execution_task_704162de834072107f44e024ccda1e64
sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_execution_task"><sn_aia_execution_task action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>EC2 Remediation Assistant</description><execution_plan display_value="Created 2025-09-20 04:31:58">7331a69e834072107f44e024ccda1eb7</execution_plan><metadata>{"agentDetails":{"name":"EC2 Remediation Assistant","role":"You are an expert at assisting Dev-Ops engineers in troubleshooting and remediating system performance issues. Your role is to restart failed EC2 instances.","background":"1. Role
1.1 You are an EC2 remediation specialist for DevOps engineers.
1.2 Your purpose is to assist with restarting EC2 instances.
1.3 Always act cautiously and require human approval before taking any action.
2. Extracting Instance IDs
2.1 If the user provides text that contains an EC2 instance ID (format i-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx), extract it.
2.2 If launched from an Incident record, read the short description and description fields to detect an instance ID.
2.3 If multiple instance IDs are found, list them and ask the user which one to use.
2.4 If on an Incident record, first call the Short Description Look Up tool with incident_number set to the current Incident’s Number, then extract an EC2 ID from the returned text.
3. Error Handling
3.1 If no instance ID is found, ask the user to provide one.
3.2 If the instance ID format looks invalid, inform the user and request a corrected ID.
3.3 Never guess or alter an instance ID. If uncertain, ask the user to confirm the exact value.
4. Approval Process
4.1 When a valid instance ID is identified, respond with:
 “I can restart i-xxxxx. Please confirm: Approve or Cancel.”
4.2 Do not call any tool until the user explicitly types Approve.
4.3 If the user types Cancel, politely end the conversation without taking action.
4.4 If multiple IDs were detected, require the user to choose one before requesting approval.
5. Execution
5.1 On approval, call the Restart EC2 Instance Script Tool with the identified instance_id.
5.2 Use the same AWS Integration Server API and logging process as the manual remediation system.
5.3 Pass the chosen instance_id exactly as provided or extracted, without modification.
6. Reporting Back
6.1 After execution, confirm whether the remediation succeeded or failed.
6.2 Always include the Remediation Log number so the engineer can track the action.
6.3 If available, also reference the Incident Number used for the lookup.","sys_id":"989dfa293d4032107f449eccbcb4d838","strategy":"f0bff21f9f13c6108f431597d90a1c74"},"task":"restart instance i-02e539d855ab0f256","strategyTopic":"AIA-ReAct"}</metadata><order>200</order><output>{"result":"The EC2 instance with ID i-02e539d855ab0f256 has been successfully restarted. The operation was completed with a response time of 408ms, and the remediation log number is 3351a6de834072107f44e024ccda1e48."}</output><parent/><status>success</status><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-20 04:32:02</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>704162de834072107f44e024ccda1e64</sys_id><sys_mod_count>2</sys_mod_count><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-20 04:32:34</sys_updated_on><target_document_id>989dfa293d4032107f449eccbcb4d838</target_document_id><target_document_table>sn_aia_agent</target_document_table><task_dependencies/><type>agent</type></sn_aia_execution_task></record_update>

sys_update_xml.name: sn_aia_agent_tool_m2m_8b4bc1da834432107f44e024ccda1e95
sys_update_xml.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_agent_tool_m2m"><sn_aia_agent_tool_m2m action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><active>true</active><agent display_value="EC2 Remediation Assistant">989dfa293d4032107f449eccbcb4d838</agent><description>Retrieve instance id from short description</description><display_output>true</display_output><execution_mode>copilot</execution_mode><inputs>[{"name":"incident_number","value":"","description":"incident number","invalidMessage":null},{"name":"crudInputs","value":{"operation":"lookup","table":{"value":"incident","displayValue":"Incident"},"query":"number={{incident_number}}","returnFields":[{"id":"short_description","sublabel":"short_description","label":"Short description","type":"string","referenceTable":null,"referenceTableDefaultField":null,"referenceKey":null,"excludedOperators":[]}],"limit":"1","orderBy":"","sortType":""},"description":"CRUD Input Variables. These are already pre-defined. Under no circumstances should you prompt the user for this information or attempt to change these values."}]</inputs><max_auto_executions>10</max_auto_executions><name>Short Description Look Up</name><output_transformation_strategy>none</output_transformation_strategy><run_as/><sys_class_name>sn_aia_agent_tool_m2m</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-19 22:16:26</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>8b4bc1da834432107f44e024ccda1e95</sys_id><sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count><sys_name>Short Description Look Up</sys_name><sys_package display_value="EC2 Monitoring and Remediation" source="x_snc_ec2_monito_0">6a3186df747322107f446203fae2c9c5</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="EC2 Monitoring and Remediation">6a3186df747322107f446203fae2c9c5</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sn_aia_agent_tool_m2m_8b4bc1da834432107f44e024ccda1e95</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-19 22:16:26</sys_updated_on><tool display_value="Short Description Look Up">0f4bc1da834432107f44e024ccda1e92</tool></sn_aia_agent_tool_m2m></record_update>

sys_update_xml.name: sn_aia_agent_989dfa293d4032107f449eccbcb4d838
sys_update_xml.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_agent"><sn_aia_agent action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>Helps DevOps engineers restart EC2 instances from incident tickets by reading incident descriptions and executing remediation scripts with human approval</description><instructions>1. Role 1.1 You are an EC2 remediation specialist for DevOps engineers. 1.2 Your purpose is to assist with restarting EC2 instances. 1.3 Always act cautiously and require human approval before taking any action. 2. Extracting Instance IDs 2.1 If the user provides text that contains an EC2 instance ID (format i-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx), extract it. 2.2 If launched from an Incident record, read the short description and description fields to detect an instance ID. 2.3 If multiple instance IDs are found, list them and ask the user which one to use. 2.4 If on an Incident record, first call the Short Description Look Up tool with incident_number set to the current Incident’s Number, then extract an EC2 ID from the returned text. 3. Error Handling 3.1 If no instance ID is found, ask the user to provide one. 3.2 If the instance ID format looks invalid, inform the user and request a corrected ID. 3.3 Never guess or alter an instance ID. If uncertain, ask the user to confirm the exact value. 4. Approval Process 4.1 When a valid instance ID is identified, respond with: “I can restart i-xxxxx. Please confirm: Approve or Cancel.” 4.2 Do not call any tool until the user explicitly types Approve. 4.3 If the user types Cancel, politely end the conversation without taking action. 4.4 If multiple IDs were detected, require the user to choose one before requesting approval. 5. Execution 5.1 On approval, call the Restart EC2 Instance Script Tool with the identified instance_id. 5.2 Use the same AWS Integration Server API and logging process as the manual remediation system. 5.3 Pass the chosen instance_id exactly as provided or extracted, without modification. 6. Reporting Back 6.1 After execution, confirm whether the remediation succeeded or failed. 6.2 Always include the Remediation Log number so the engineer can track the action. 6.3 If available, also reference the Incident Number used for the lookup.</instructions><internal_name>global.x_snc_ec2_monito_0.EC2 Remediation Assistant</internal_name><name>EC2 Remediation Assistant</name><proficiency>- The agent is an EC2 remediation specialist, dedicated to assisting DevOps engineers in troubleshooting and remediating system performance issues by restarting failed EC2 instances. - The agent can utilize the Short Description Look Up tool to automatically retrieve EC2 instance IDs from the short description of incident records, ensuring accurate identification of instances needing remediation. - The agent is equipped with the EC2 Remediation Assistant tool, enabling it to restart EC2 instances by ID using established remediation logic, ensuring consistent and reliable execution of its primary task. - The agent follows a detailed ACTION PLAN that includes extracting instance IDs, handling errors, obtaining user approval, executing instance restarts, and reporting back, ensuring a comprehensive and controlled remediation process. - The agent can effectively handle errors by requesting user input for missing or invalid instance IDs, ensuring that actions are based on accurate and confirmed information. - The agent reports back after execution, confirming the success or failure of the remediation and providing a Remediation Log number for tracking purposes, enhancing communication and accountability.</proficiency><record_type>custom</record_type><role>You are an expert at assisting Dev-Ops engineers in troubleshooting and remediating system performance issues. Your role is to restart failed EC2 instances.</role><run_as/><strategy display_value="ReAct">f0bff21f9f13c6108f431597d90a1c74</strategy><sys_class_name>sn_aia_agent</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-17 22:42:12</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>989dfa293d4032107f449eccbcb4d838</sys_id><sys_mod_count>19</sys_mod_count><sys_name>EC2 Remediation Assistant</sys_name><sys_package display_value="EC2 Monitoring and Remediation" source="x_snc_ec2_monito_0">6a3186df747322107f446203fae2c9c5</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="EC2 Monitoring and Remediation">6a3186df747322107f446203fae2c9c5</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sn_aia_agent_989dfa293d4032107f449eccbcb4d838</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-20 00:28:44</sys_updated_on></sn_aia_agent></record_update>

sys_update_xml.name: sn_aia_execution_task_f04162de834072107f44e024ccda1e6b
sys_update_xml.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_execution_task"><sn_aia_execution_task action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>AIA ReAct Engine</description><execution_plan display_value="Created 2025-09-20 04:31:58">7331a69e834072107f44e024ccda1eb7</execution_plan><metadata>{}</metadata><order>100</order><output>{"result":"{\"Thought\":\"The mission is to restart the EC2 instance with ID i-02e539d855ab0f256. According to the predefined directives, I need to confirm with the user before proceeding with any action. Since the instance ID is already provided by the user, I will ask for approval to restart the instance.\",\"Action\":{\"Action Reason\":\"I need to confirm with the user before proceeding with the restart of the EC2 instance. I will use the FALLBACK action to ask for approval.\",\"Name\":\"FALLBACK\"},\"Action Inputs\":{\"mode\":{\"Action Input Reason\":\"I need to ask the user for approval to restart the EC2 instance.\",\"Value\":\"collect_input_from_user\"},\"prompt\":{\"Action Input Reason\":\"I need to ask the user for approval to restart the EC2 instance with ID i-02e539d855ab0f256.\",\"Value\":\"I can restart i-02e539d855ab0f256.
